segments.text: I just got a call from Mrs . Fitzgerald . See what your Willie has just done .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My Willie ? Why has he suddenly become my Willie ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Because he takes after you , he's got into trouble again .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What did he do this time ? I remember last time he was painting her fence to repay her for breaking it , and he accidentally painted her cat .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That was last time . This time it's worse .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , he was playing baseball with some friends ...
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And the ball went through her window ? That's not as bad as last time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: True , but that's not all . The ball went through the window and hit the vase she has in her front window ...
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok , that's probably expensive , but not that bad .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And then , ricocheted off her fish bowl . Mrs . Fitzgerald at the last minute dived and saved her fish .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: At least the fish were saved . If that's the end of the damages , then everything isn't that bad .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Stop interrupting me . Finally , the ball flew through the air and knocked out Willie's school principal , who was having a cup of coffee with Mrs . Fitzgerald .
segments.speaker: S1
